column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=3.
#Text=Fault Signals for Detection
#Text=This section discuss the signals used for fault detection for the methods proposed .
#Text=Signals are generated such that the fault detection is more clear .
#Text=3.1.
#Text=Commanded Voltages Method
#Text=The difference in the voltages between healthy and faulty cases is directly proportional to the difference in the flux linkages of healthy and faulty case .
#Text=The difference between the flux linkages is significant in certain range of the current .
#Text=The difference is maximum at the point shown in
#Text=Figure 4
#Text=.
#Text=Therefore , for fault detection the machine should be operated as close as possible to point of maximum separation .
#Text=3.2. Calculation of Incremental Inductance
#Text=Incremental inductance is generated by using DC current injection in the d-axis with constant rotation .
#Text=The current is injected with increasing current levels and the q-axis voltage ( ) is recorded at each level .
#Text=The value of d-axis flux ( ) is calculated from the q-axis voltage ( ) .
#Text=Finally , incremental inductance is calculated by taking the derivative of vs. curve given by ( 29 )
#Text=The difference in the two current levels is .
#Text=Therefore , the above relation reduces to ( 30 ) where is the difference in the flux linkages at two different levels of current .
#Text=and are shown in
#Text=Figure 5
#Text=.
#Text=The difference in current levels is chosen such that there is a measurable difference in the q-axis voltages between two levels .
#Text=The minimum difference in current levels is chosen once measurable difference in the voltages is recorded , because increased difference in current levels decreases peak prominence .
#Text=3.3. Harmonics in Voltage and Current Signals
#Text=The first 15 harmonics present in IAP ( Instantaneous Active Power ) are used for analysis for fault detection which was extracted using FFT ( Fast Fourier Transform ) .
#Text=The harmonic that shows the maximum separation between the healthy and faulty cases is used for analysis .
#Text=The machine is operated at the same operating conditions as it is operated for commanded voltages method .
#Text=3.4. Vibration Signals
#Text=for Analysis
#Text=The oscillating forces were calculated by using FEA model .
#Text=First the magnitude of magnetic field density was calculated around the rotor .
#Text=After that for an angle , as shown in
#Text=Figure 6
#Text=, radial stress was estimated using Equation ( 31 ) .
#Text=( 31 )
#Text=Then , the stress is calculated by taking projections in y and x-axis as follows ( 32 ) ( 33 )
#Text=Net force at a given time can be calculated by integrating the forces over the periphery of the rotor . ( 34 ) ( 35 )
#Text=Therefore , forces are estimated using flux density at different times .
#Text=Once , forces are estimated , FFT is performed and results are analyzed .

#Text=To analyze the vibration signals the accelerometers were placed on both stator core and rotor bearing in the direction of static eccentricity ( y-axis ) and 90 °apart from the direction of static eccentricity ( x-axis ) .
#Text=The arrangement of accelerometers on the rotor bearing and stator core is shown in
#Text=Figure 7
#Text=.
